info.name: Agrar Portal API
info.description:
# Agrar Portal API Collection

This collection contains all API endpoints for the Agrar Portal system including:

## Features
- **Authentication & 2FA**: Complete authentication flow with OTP verification
- **Training Management**: Full CRUD operations with media upload support
- **Hybrid Media Approach**: Both single endpoint and separate media endpoints
- **Online/Offline Training**: Support for both training types with detailed configurations
- **User Management**: Admin operations and profile management
- **Exam System**: Complete exam creation and taking functionality
- **Forum**: Q&A system for community interaction
- **Progress Tracking**: User progress monitoring
- **Payment Integration**: Payment processing and webhooks

## Training Media Upload Options

### Single Endpoint Approach
- Create training with files in one request: `POST /api/v1/trainings`
- Update training with files: `PATCH /api/v1/trainings/{id}`
- Best for: Small files, simple workflows, atomic operations

### Separate Endpoint Approach  
- Upload media to existing training: `POST /api/v1/trainings/{id}/upload-media`
- Get training media: `GET /api/v1/trainings/{id}/media`
- Remove specific media: `DELETE /api/v1/trainings/{id}/media/{path}`
- Best for: Large files, progressive upload, advanced file management

## New Training Fields
- `type`: "online" or "offline"
- `online_details`: { participant_size, google_meet_link }
- `offline_details`: { participant_size, address, coordinates }
- `media_files`: Unified media storage with type categorization

## Usage
1. Set `{{base_url}}` variable to your API base URL
2. Set `{{auth_token}}` variable with your authentication token
3. Use the appropriate endpoint based on your use case

request.description: Create a new training with basic information. Use this for simple training creation without files.

formdata.value: Learn advanced farming techniques with multimedia content

formdata.description: Upload banner image (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, webp - max 5MB)
Upload intro video (mp4, avi, mov, wmv, flv, webm - max 20MB)
Upload general media files (any format - max 50MB each)
Google Meet link for online training

request.description: Create a new training with media files in one request. Best for small files and simple workflows.
Create an offline training with physical location details. Perfect for field training and hands-on workshops.
Update an existing training to change from online to offline mode. Useful when training format needs to change.
Update an existing training to change from offline to online mode. Perfect for adapting to changing circumstances.

formdata.value: Complete Training with All Media Types
Comprehensive training with banner, video, and multiple documents

request.description: Create a complete training with all types of media files in one request. Demonstrates the full capability of the single endpoint approach.

formdata.value: Updated description with new media files

formdata.description: Replace banner image (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, webp - max 5MB)
Replace intro video (mp4, avi, mov, wmv, flv, webm - max 20MB)
Add new general media files (any format - max 50MB each)
New banner image to replace existing one

item.name: Update Training - Add Media Files Only

request.description: Upload media files to an existing training using separate endpoint. Useful for adding files after training creation or for large file uploads.
Get all media files for a specific training. Returns categorized media files with URLs.
Remove a specific media file from training. Use the file path as the mediaId parameter.

item.name: Training Media Management (Separate Endpoints)
item.description: Separate endpoints for advanced media file management. Use these for large files, progressive upload, or adding files to existing trainings.

formdata.description: Banner image file (optional) - JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP (max 5MB)
Intro video file (optional) - MP4, AVI, MOV, WMV, FLV, WebM (max 20MB)
General media files (optional, multiple allowed) - Any file type (max 50MB each)

request.description: Upload media files to an existing training using separate endpoint. Perfect for adding files after training creation or for large file uploads.
Get all media files for a specific training. Returns categorized media files with full URLs for easy frontend integration.
Remove a specific media file from training. Use the file path as the mediaId parameter. The file path can be found in the media files list.

formdata.description: Large media files (optional, multiple allowed) - Any file type (max 50MB each)

request.description: Upload large media files to an existing training. Use this for files larger than 10MB or when you want better error handling for file uploads.

item.name: Add Single Choice Question with Media
Add Multiple Choice Question with Media
